Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew W. Gendron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.
No contact with Walmart in Rib Mountain

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Counseling, assessments deemed appropriate by agent.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew W. Gendron

records.addlTxt: from defendant requesting amended JOC;  cc ADA Kerri Puig and Atty Anne Renc; stj

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:44 am 
INCLUDES 18CF458, 17CF450, 15CF1115, AND 16CM2205. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Anne Renc. 

PLEA HEARING IN 18CF458. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent - Heroin/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 18CF458 & SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 17CF450, 15CF1115, AND 16CM2205. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 18CF458: Ct. 1>>6 yrs imprisonment - 3 yrs IC & 3 yrs ES - imposed and STAYED for 4 years probation - CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: participate in & complete Drug Recovery Court; 6 months MCJ - 5 months STAYED for rule violations and 1 month to be served; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS - imposition of condition is up to agent; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 
                                                                                                                                                                                - CONDITIONS OF ES (if imposed)>> assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; payment of any unpaid costs. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 99 days jail credit in 18CF458. 
COURT finds the def eligible to CIP and SAP in 18CF458. 

In 17CF450: Ct. 1>>1 year MCJ with 211 days credit; unpaid costs converted to civil judgment. 
In 15CF1115: Ct. 2>>1 year MCJ with 351 days credit; unpaid costs converted to civil judgment. 
In 16CM2205: Cts. 1 & 3 >>9 months MCJ with 304 days credit; unpaid costs converted to civil judgment. 

COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 

Adj: 10:01 am
Probation Revocation Packet
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 24, 2018 at 09:45 am.
